description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 By the end of 2019, about 200 parliamentarians and parliamentary staff in Southeast Asia have increased capacity in legislative and democratic development in the region. The capacity of parliamentarians in Southeast Asia to engage constructively in the legislative process will be strengthened through the provision of research products which follow standard practices for parliamentary research services globally and the provision of regional exchange. The regional activities will comprise trainings for regional fellows on parliamentary research, English, legal analysis, legislative drafting, parliamentary communications, public policy evaluation, parliamentary budget analysis, regional comparatives studies, regional information exchange network, and seminars. The parliaments with well-equipped knowledge will be better respond to the constituents’ needs and local reality. Capacity building will eventually lead to a better sharing of power, an improved management of conflicting interests and effective systems of checks and balances as key elements for enhanced governance.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 I slutet av 2019, förväntas cirka 200 parlamentariker och parlamentarisk personal i Sydostasien ha ökad kapacitet i lagstiftnings- och demokratisk utveckling. Kapaciteten hos parlamentariker i Sydostasien att engagera sig på ett konstruktivt sätt i lagstiftningsprocessen kommer att förstärkas genom tillhandahållande av forskningsprodukter som följer standardmetoder för parlamentarisk forskning globalt och genom regionalt utbyte. De regionala aktiviteterna kommer att omfatta utbildningar inom parlamentarisk forskning, engelska, juridisk analys, lagberedning, riksdagskommunikation, utvärdering, parlamentariska budgetanalys, regionala jämförelsetal, regionalt informationsutbyte samt nätverk och seminarier. Mer välutrustade med kunskap kommer parlamenten bli bättre svara på behov från den lokala verkligheten. Kapacitetsuppbyggnad förväntas så småningom att leda till en bättre fördelning av makt, en förbättrad hantering av motstridiga intressen och effektiva system för maktfördelning som nyckelfaktorer för ökad styrning.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative: During the 2019 reporting period, PIC implemented most of its planned regional activities focusing on building parliamentary staff capacity on research, diplomacy, seminar, and outreach. The relationship with ASEAN Inter-parliamentary Assembly (AIPA) was strengthened by the renewal of their MoU in June 2019. In this reporting year, PIC has been under the institutional transition from the national to the regional entity. PIC Headquarters moved out of the Cambodian Senate compound whereas the Research, Outreach, and Accountability and Transparency program Department remain in the Senate compound. The remaining functions will be hand-overed in 2020. The reorganization into the Parliamentary Centre of Asia (PCAsia) will be intensified in the next reporting period and led to the change in the result in which key activities will be dedicated for strengthening of the institutional function to meet the need in the region. In term of budget, during the year 2019, the PIC Regional Program received a total of USD 1,154,787 ( USD 284,787 from the Embassy of Sweden in Bangkok and USD 870,000 from SDC -Switzerland). The budget for 2020 is totally USD 1,750,000 in which the Embassy of Sweden accounted for USD 89,049 (approximately SEK 870,000). The examples of results/key activities included: - 14 fellows (4 males) from AIPA attending Regional Fellowship Program on Parliamentary Research (RFPPR). The module included the basic knowledge of Parliamentary Research and methodology, communication skills, legislative analysis, fiscal analysis, gender analysis. The thematic coverage was waste, water, and energy management (i.e water pollution in Myanmar, forestry law enforcement in Laos, status and challenges of rural electrification in Cambodia and renewable energy options, etc.). - 14 working regional briefing notes were subsequently produced and a regional seminar on this topic was organised. Training of trainers on parliamentary research was for 37 (21 females) regional participants. The program aims to create a pool of trainers (selected from AIPA Member Parliaments), equipped to train their colleagues on parliamentary research in the respective language, thereby expanding the pool of possible trainees. - A Seminar on “Parliamentary Responsibilities: Strengthening the Institutions” was organised for 42 parliamentary staff (14 females) . This seminar fostered interaction and exchanges among participants on selected themes, for example, a general understanding of parliamentary functions and the Secretariat support services, lessons from the capacity building experience of PIC, as well as parliamentary procedures, working methods and tools introduced by practitioners from legislatures such as the French National Assembly, the Legislative Assembly of Ontario, and the UK House of Commons. - Regional Fellowship Program on Parliamentary Diplomacy was organised for 13 fellows (9 females). The program combined both face to face and blended learning (online learning and coaching) with a variety of topics including core principles of parliamentary diplomacy, international law, international relations and geopolitics, parliamentary research skills, international communication, conflict analysis and resolution, and transnational and gender issues. The trainees gained practical knowledge on related issues. - Regional workshop on policy evaluation was conducted for 101 parliamentary staff. The training covered parliamentary evaluation best practices, methods and techniques. The workshop was delivered by practitioners from the Parliaments of France, Canada and Rwanda. - PIC deepens its collaborations with a regional network, AIPA. Three themes have been selected as research and discussion topics for the PIC capacity development framework, including (i) Gender mainstreaming; (ii) Environment and climate change, (iii) The role of Parliament in conflict resolution. The development perspective have been finally get buy-in from the ASEAN level/AIPA as the annual thematic areas of research. Another outstanding output was on the gender equality in which PIC worked with a gender specialist from International Development Law organization (IDLO) to design a specialized curriculum on Gender for Parliamentary works and diplomacy in the ASEAN context. - Transition and institutionalization of the PCAsia : PIC launched a strategic planning process for the period 2020-2025. The retreat was organised internally to prepare the full launch of its regional set-up in 2020. The consultative process and steps were discussed on its transitional plan, financial sustainability, and legal issues of registration. - During Covid19, the online Learning method will be applied to every program that can accommodate it. The research topic will also include the Public Health policies, in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
